instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Turns on but very slow MBP 820-2936-B
threads.message:
I have watched several videos on this from Mr. Rossmann but I can not figure out how to locate errors identified in ASD.. finding the right version is an entirely different issue... I would really appreciate any assistance possible.
Is there a report of some kind that identifies the errors? my current error is 4SNS/ 1 /40000001:VP0R-0.000  (have also previously received 4SNS/ 1 /40000001:VP0R-0.038 and 4SNS/ 1 /40000001:VP0R-0.006)

2011 MBP 13" board 820-2936-B

threads.title: Turns on but very slow MBP 820-2936-B
threads.message: Corrosion around Q5300 and the 2 resistors there.

threads.title: Turns on but very slow MBP 820-2936-B
threads.message:
Thank you so much.  I'll clean and replace them all.

Is there a diagram that shows the VP0R errors or the ASD errors?

threads.title: Turns on but very slow MBP 820-2936-B
threads.message: Nope but vp0r is listed in the 3115 diagram.

threads.title: Turns on but very slow MBP 820-2936-B
threads.message:
I'm sorry and new to this so I have no idea what a 3115 diagram is.

I replaced Q5300 and both resistors.. of course I have a new VP0R error now..  Very weird, frustrating... all of the above :)

4SNS/ 1 /40000001:VP0R--12.214

threads.title: Turns on but very slow MBP 820-2936-B
threads.message: VP0R is reading 12.214V so the sensor is working fine now. Does this machine power on without the battery installed?

threads.title: Turns on but very slow MBP 820-2936-B
threads.message: The very second that I connected the power supply it turned itself on.

threads.title: Turns on but very slow MBP 820-2936-B
threads.message: So the error isn't an error.... Makes perfect sense.. so Apple and Microsoft aren't so different after all. FEATURE, not error.

threads.title: Turns on but very slow MBP 820-2936-B
threads.message: Run the normal EFI version of ASD, not the built-in one. The sensor should read 12.5V without the battery connected. Are you sure you put Q5300 in the right way around?

threads.title: Turns on but very slow MBP 820-2936-B
threads.message:
Sorry for the delay. I was a little busy.
I ran ASD via the internet version.  Couldn't find the correct files to make the USB drive ASD EFI.

Assuming that pin 1 has the little dent on the top of the IC, yes pin one is to ground.

threads.title: Turns on but very slow MBP 820-2936-B
threads.message: As long as it is not slow anymore now, just leave it.
